DOC.brief_summary: The study group of Adults with ADHD who will receive cognitive (executive attention) computerized training will show significant improvement in ADHD symptomatology,neuropsychological measures,daily functioning and quality of life. A significant difference will be found between the study group and the control group (adults with ADHD that will receive a simplified cognitive training program that does not challenge their executive functions)on the above measures.
DOC.brief_title: The Efficacy of Computerized Cognitive Training in Adults With ADHD: Change in ADHD Symptoms, Executive Functions and Quality of Life Following Three Months of Training.
DOC.criteria: Adults (age 1860); 9 years education; Diagnosis of ADHD; Executive function deficit in daily life; Signed informed consent. Change in pharmacological treatment and/or received new treatment for ADHD in the last three months; Other current serious neurological disorder (e.g. epilepsy, brain injury, neurodegenerative disease), other major current and sever psychiatric disorder (axisI); Color blindness.
